intro: Cheilosoria hancockii, commonly known as Hancock's cheilosoria, is a rare and striking flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to red. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in areas with high altitude and cool temperatures. Its unique floral structure attracts specific pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
